This is NOT GOTY Deluxe edition...
it is oblivion + all the expansions... which give you the same content as GOTY Deluxe, but isn't actually the GOTY Deluxe
(I already had all of it, I was trying to replace 3 disk install + 8 exe installs with 1 or 2 installs; this just gave me all the same content in 11 tedious installs)

actually, upon further inspection it is NOT even all the content of the GOTY Deluxe. It is all the content of GOTY... what is the difference between GOTY and GOTY deluxe? the deluxe version comes with "Fighter's Stronghold" update as well. This doesn't.

After a long search (downloading every single version of oblivion on TPB) I finally found a real GOTY edition... it was literally the last one I tried, one with the fewest seeds... I quickly discovered why... It turns out that bethusda put securom DRM on the setup.exe files such that INSTALLING the game requires the original CD inserted (or a cracked setup.exe, available seperately from reloaded and a PITA to incorprate)... and even UNINSTALLING requires the original CD (turns out a lot of frustrated people who has stopped playing years ago, came to uninstall, couldn't find their CD, and now can't uninstall it)... I was hoping to save installs (12 seperate installs total!) but its just not worth it. Might as well stick with the 12 install method...
This version gets commended for including a patch and a crack for that patch. Best way to get all oblivion is to download THIS version followed by downloading the "Fighter's Stronghold" DLC separately.

This is how you fix it. It took me freaking ages to find out how, but it's pretty simple.
First, mount the second disc, the one with SI on it.
Now try and install the update. If it works, you're all good my friend.
If you get that "Old file not found" thing, then don't worry, I got you covered.
Just click Install Shivering Isles instead, that includes the patch that fixes the purple ground.
That's how I fixed mine.
I hope this helps some other poor bastard like me get his game on!

So I fixed the black screen issue. After reading ALL the comments and finding multiple people with the same problem but no answers... I was able to fix it myself. 

All I did was click on the shortcut oblivion which opens up the menu you'd get off the DVD, I then looked in the mods that were on and off, and apparently it was set with Oblivion, the main file... Off... So I switched it on and it's working perfectly now.

You should get DAEMON Tools, it was easier to me. Once you get DAEMON Tools, you should install it. Once you install it, there should be a icon on your taskbar with a little CD with a lightning bolt inside. 'Purple grass' fix here! If you're having the 'purple grass' (grass in outdoor areas being replaced by a purple map texture) problem, it's caused by having the wrong shaders. The file you need is "1175886746_Shaders.rar" Put that into google and it'll give you a link to a Youtube page.. on there are the links to download the file. You extract all the files in the .rar to your oblivion/data/shaders folder and overwrite. Hey presto, fixed, everything is as it should be :) Guarantee that this works, 100% .I struggled with this problem for ages before figuring it out, so there ya go.

For those with the "This program has stopped working" blah blah blah issue, after a fresh install (so for me, just started it up first time..little black box on corner and program stopped error, followed instructions to the dot)

Just run the Oblivion ISO again, go to options, turn on HDR (Its the special effects, middle options on the bottom rectangle) (I also changed my screen resolution) and it opened up, havent got past that, but it got the game to run for me.

key problems have to do with your keyboard remove or update driver check keyb settings in the game if ur keyb has usb connections and something is pluged in that could be the problem

@Po1ntBlnK - that type of sound problem is normally caused by having your sound manager setup for 5:1 or 7:1 sound and not actually having a Center channel speaker connected !! -- if set for 5:1 the conversations are played through the center channel and if there is no speaker there the sounds will not play !!

Complete Instructions on how to Install this:
What you need -
uTorrent
This Torrent
Daemon Tools Lite
What to do -
1. Download this Torrent through uTorrent
2. Open up the downloaded File
3. Open up Daemon Tools Lite
4. Search for the ISO file in the downloaded File using Daemon Tools
5. Mount the ISO file
6. Look for the Other ISO file in the Downloaded file and Mount that as well
7. Look at the First Mounted File by going to "My Computer" or "Computer" and clicking on the Drive that says Oblivion
8. Click (Double) on Setup.exe
9. After It is finished, go to the Second Mounted File by looking for the Drive that says SI_KOTN
10. Right Click on it and click Open
11. Click (Double) on CD_Start
12. Click on each of them, One at a Time (I don't think the Third is needed but you can do it If you want)
13. Go to the Crack File and Drag the Stuff (Only one thing and It is called Oblivion) to the Installed Oblivion File (Local Disk C: > Program Files >  Program Files/x86 (Depends on OS) > Bethesda Softworks) and Replace the file
14. Done :D

Typical Installation. (you must have a DVD burner)

 1. Install Alcohol 120% and put the crack
 2. Extract the zip files. Mdf and. Mds and put them in one folder
 3. Open alcohol and click "Burn Image" and put the path where the file resides mds
 4. Burn
 5. Start the CD and install the game
 6. Before starting the game no-cd crack to extract from the zip and put it in the root folder of the game (C: \ Program Files \ Rockstar Games \ GTA San Andreas), replacing the existing file
 7. Now you can play, have fun!



 . Custom Installation. (must have at least 13GB of hard drive space)

 1. Install Alcohol 120% and put the crack
 2. Extract the zip files. Mdf and. Mds and put them in one folder
 3. Open alcohol and click on "Virtual Devices"
 4. Choose a number, based on how many virtual cd players you want (minimum 1)
 5. Do ok in the box below and you will find the new device virual, right-click on it and then mount image
 6. Put the path where the file mds
 7. You will see the game from the autoplay using images from the hard
 8. Install the game and start it before you remove the no-cd crack from the zip and put it in the root folder of the game (C: \ Program Files \ Rockstar Games \ GTA San Andreas), replacing the existing file
 9. Now you can play, have fun!



 For any problems please contact me at this address: squallol@hotmail.it

Also, for any of you having the issue where you can load the menu, but not create a new game, you have to mount the second (shivering isles) disk, explore the disk, open the "crack" folder, and copy the oblivion file inside to the game directory. There should be in the game directory a non-cracked version of the same thing, so you will need to verify that you want to replace that file with the cracked version and such, but then the game should work. At least it did for me.
